project.title: GREEN AMBASSADORS CLUB
project.description:
### ğŸŒ The Challenge Weâ€™re Tackling 

Kimi Island, Uganda, is home to around 5,500 residents in the communities of Kimi Kachanga and Kimi Banga. These residents face urgent challenges: inadequate infrastructure, poor healthcare access, environmental degradation, and the lasting impact of a devastating fire in 2017. Without action, the communityâ€”especially youth and vulnerable familiesâ€”will continue to face hardships and limited opportunities.

### ğŸ“œ Our Solution

The Kimi Restoration Campaign is a community-led initiative launched in response to these challenges. Spearheaded by the Green Ambassadors Club and supported by partners, the campaign takes a holistic approach focused on:
- ğŸ’ª Youth empowerment through skills training in soap making and reusable sanitary towel production.
- ğŸŒ¿ Environmental conservation and the promotion of sustainable, local livelihoods.
- âš•ï¸ Healthcare improvement, including installing solar-powered systems for medicine storage, advocating for a stationed nurse, and organizing medical campsâ€”one recently served 1,500 residents.
- ğŸ”† Clean energy access via the distribution of solar lamps to students and families.
- ğŸš» Improved hygiene and sanitation with new restrooms near schools and the clinic.

### ğŸŒ± Our Organisation / Community

This initiative is driven by local leaders, youth, and families on Kimi Island. Together, we are working to build a healthier, more self-reliant, and environmentally responsible future.

### ğŸ–¼ï¸ See Our Impact

![Kimi Restoration Impact Image](https://www.ecocertain.xyz/_next/image?url=%2Fapi%2Fhypercert-image%2F42220-0x16bA53B74c234C870c61EFC04cD418B8f2865959-57848002376559538788773683263400595947520&w=640&q=75)

### ğŸ”— [View Our Hypercert](https://ecocertain.vercel.app/hypercert/42220-0x16bA53B74c234C870c61EFC04cD418B8f2865959-58528567110401415715700432478264132370432)

### ğŸ“ What This Hypercert Represents
- Trained 500 youth and single mothers in soap, Vaseline, and reusable product making.
- Provided food and clothing to vulnerable families.
- Installed solar systems in clinics and distributed solar lights.
- Organized medical camps serving hundreds of residents.
- Built community restrooms to improve hygiene standards.

###  âœ… Proof That Itâ€™s Working

Weâ€™ve collected photos, testimonials, and data that showcase the tangible results of our work.

### ğŸ“‚ [See the Proof of Impact](https://photos.app.goo.gl/V6CQzq79PJ1Egwc6A)
